title: Consider the Ion Charge
text: Remember that a Ca**2+** ion means it has lost $$2$$ electrons. How does this affect the number of electrons from the neutral atom?

title: Know the Neutral Atom Structure
text: What is the total number of electrons in a neutral calcium atom (Ca)?

title: Subtract to Find the Answer
text: The neutral calcium atom has a certain number of electrons. Subtract the number of electrons lost to form Ca**2+**. This will give the number of electrons in the ion.
